      • orThrow

        public <E extends RuntimeException> ThrowingUnaryOperator<T> orThrow(Class<E> exclass)
        Description copied from class: Chainer
        Rethrow the exception using a custom (unchecked!) exception class if this throwing instance fails

        Your custom exception class must have a constructor accepting a single Throwable as an argument.

        The original exception thrown will be the cause of the generated exception.

        All instances of Error or RuntimeException thrown by the instance are thrown as is.

        Specified by:
        orThrow in class Chainer<UnaryOperator<T>,ThrowingUnaryOperator<T>,UnaryOperatorChainer<T>>
        Type Parameters:
        E - type parameter of the exception class
        Parameters:
        exclass - the exception class
        Returns:
        a throwing instance
